intro: Pentacalia yanethiarum, commonly known as the Yanethiarum milkweed, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweed species known for their milky sap. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white. It is adapted to grow in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The plant's unique morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
